description.lang: Slim Multisensor PST02-A/B/C

inclusionNote.lang: Press the tamper key three times within 1,5 seconds.

description.lang: Group 1 receives report messages such as triggered events, temperature, illumination etc. (8 devices maximum).
Group 2 is for light control, the sensor will send the "Basic Set" command to this group (8 devices maximum).
Sets the light intensity level sent with the "Basic Set" command to devices associated in group 2.
0: Turn off the light
1-100: Light intensity in percent (for dimmer devices)
255: Turn on the light
Sets the sensitivity of the PIR sensor. A higher sensitivity means detection over a greater distance but if there is too much signal noise in the environment the sensor will trigger too frequently.
0: Disable PIR motion detection completely
1: Lowest sensitivity
2-99: Sensor sensitivity in percent
99: Highest sensitivity

name.lang: Illumination threshold for turning on light

description.lang: When an door/window and/or PIR motion event occurs and the detected illumination level is below this threshold, the sensor will turn on the light. Set to the maximum value to always turn on the light.
0: Disable turning on light based on illumination
1: Darkest illumination level
2-99: Illumination level in percent
100: Brightest illumination level
Enables/disables aspects of general operation.
Bit 0 (=1) Reserved
Bit 1 (=2): Enable test mode (this setting is only considered if DIP switches are in position OFF-OFF).
Bit 2 (=4): Disable Door/window state detection completely (PST02-A and PST02-C only)
Bit 3 (=8): Use degrees Celcius as temperature scale instead of degrees Fahrenheit
Bit 4 (=16): Disable illumination level report when door/window and/or PIR motion events occur
Bit 5 (=32): Disable temperature report when door/window and/or PIR motion events occur
Bit 6 (=64): Reserved
Bit 7 (=128): Do not activate test mode when back key is released
Enables/disables aspects of sensor operation.
Bit 0 (=1): Disable turning on light when door/window opens and illumination level is dark enough (PST02-C; PST02-A only if Bit 2 is 1)
Bit 1 (=2): Disable turning on light when PIR motion event occurs and illumination level is dark enough (PST02-B; PST-02A only if Bit 2 is 1)
Bit 2 (=4): Apply Bit 0 (PST02-C) and Bit 1 (PST02-B) on PST02-A devices, too
Bit 3 (=8): Sensor and controlled light are in different rooms (in this case you'll likely want to set bit 1 as well) (PST02-A only)
Bit 4 (=16): Disable waiting 5 seconds before turning off light when door/window closes (ignored if Cfg 7 Bit 3 is set) (PST02-A and PST02-C only)
Bit 5 (=32): Disable turning off the light after a delay after door/window opening turned it on (see also Cfg 9) (PST02-A and PST02-C only)
Bit 6 (=64): Reserved
Bit 7 (=128): Reserved
Enables/disables additional aspects of operation.
Bit 0 (=1): Reserved
Bit 1 (=2): Enable sending PIR motion "off" reports (PST02-A and PST02-B only)
Bit 2 (=4): Enable PIR super sensitivity mode (PST02-A and PST02-B only)
Bit 3 (=8): Disable unconditionally turning off light when door/window closes irrespective of whether we turned it on (PST02-A and PST02-C only)
Bit 4 (=16): Use "sensor binary report" as notification type instead of "notification report"
Bit 5 (=32): Disable use of Multi Command Class in reports which are sometimes not supported by receiving devices
Bit 6 (=64): Disable reporting battery state when door/window and/or PIR motion events occur
Bit 7 (=128): Reserved

name.lang: PIR redetection delay (PST02-A and PST02-B only, ignored in Test mode)

description.lang: Sets the time to wait after a motion event was triggered by the PIR sensor before another event can be triggered. Choose a suitable value to prevent the sensor from generating too many events and to save battery energy. Note that if this value is higher than the value of configuration setting 9 (Turn Off Light delay) there will be a period of time in which the light is turned off and the PIR will not yet detect motion again. The value set here will be multiplied by 8, ie. a value of 1 means 8 seconds. In test mode this setting is ignored and a fixed delay of 6 seconds is used.
1: 8 seconds
2-126: Delay divided by 8 seconds
127: 1016 seconds

Sets the time to wait to turn the light off again if it was turned by a sensor event and no PIR motion was detected during this time. The value set here will be multiplied by 8, ie. a value of 1 means 8 seconds.
0: Do not turn the light off automatically
1: 8 seconds
2-126: Delay divided by 8 seconds
127: 1016 seconds

Sets the frequency for sending battery level reports to devices associated in group 1. The value specified here is interpreted relative to the interval specified in configuration setting 20 (Report interval), ie. if this value is 2 and the value of setting 20 is 300, battery level reports will be sent every 600 seconds.
0: Do not send battery level reports
1: Send battery level reports at each interval
2-127: Send battery level reports at every n-th interval

name.lang: Door/window state reports frequency (PST02-A and PST02-C only)

description.lang: Sets the frequency for sending door/window state reports to devices associated in group 1. The value specified here is interpreted relative to the interval specified in configuration setting 20 (Report interval), ie. if this value is 2 and the value of setting 20 is 300, door/window state reports will be sent every 600 seconds.
0: Do not send door/window state reports
1: Send door/window state reports at each interval
2-127: Send door/window state reports at every n-th interval

Sets the frequency for sending illumination level reports to devices associated in group 1. The value specified here is interpreted relative to the interval specified in configuration setting 20 (Report interval), ie. if this value is 2 and the value of setting 20 is 300, illumination level reports will be sent every 600 seconds.
0: Do not send illumination level reports
1: Send illumination level reports at each interval
2-127: Send illumination level reports at every n-th interval

Sets the frequency for sending temperature reports to devices associated in group 1. The value specified here is interpreted relative to the interval specified in configuration setting 20 (Report interval), ie. if this value is 2 and the value of setting 20 is 300, temperature reports will be sent every 600 seconds.
0: Do not send temperature reports
1: Send temperature reports at each interval
2-127: Send temperature reports at every n-th interval

Sets the interval in seconds used as base for the frequencies specified with configuration settings 10 (Battery level), 11 (Door/window state), 12 (Illumination level) and 13 (temperature) to calculate the actual interval, ie. if this value is 2 and the value of setting 10 is 300, battery level reports will be sent every 600 seconds. Specifying a value of 0 here will disable all reports.
0: Do not send any reports
1-255: Interval in seconds

Sets the interval in minutes at which to wake up and check for temperature changes. If enabled, the sensor will periodically wake up and check whether the temperature has changed by more than 1째 Fahrenheit (0.56째 Celcius). If it has, or if the current temperature lies above 140째 Fahrenheit (60째 Celcius), a report will be sent to the devices associated in group 1. Note that during temperature measurement the PIR sensor is not active, meaning there will be one second during each interval in which the PIR sensor will be "blind". Even if disabled here, temperature reports will still be sent when the PIR sensor detects motion and/or the door/window state changes if such functionality has been enabled in configuration setting 5 (Operation mode).
0: Disable temperature change reports
1-127: Interval in minutes at which to check for temperature changes

Sets the minimum difference by which the illumination level needs to change for a report to be sent. If enabled, the sensor will wake up every minute and compare the current illumination level against the stored previous level. Note that during illumination measurement the PIR sensor is not active, meaning there will be one second during each interval in which the PIR sensor will be "blind". Even if disabled here, illumination level reports will still be sent when the PIR sensor detects motion and/or the door/window state changes if such functionality has been enabled in configuration setting 5 (Operation mode).
0: Disable illumination level change reports
1-127: Level illumination needs to change for a report to be sent
